Don  francisco,de 65 años de edad, originario de la comarca llamada el Boquerón, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 6 hijos  mayores de edad, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de chile, desde hace 10 años, el  cual realiza su siembra en un   pedazo de tierra  que le regalaron, el cual ha ido aumentando sus tierras  con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo para  ampliar su área de siembra. Cuando él no está  cultivando sus chiles, se dedica a sembrar maíz para incrementar sus ganancias y obtener mejores ingresos económicos, ya que su cosecha chiles la vende en Managua en donde le pagan a un buen precio.
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  abono, combustibles para la planta de riego, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra en su siembra de chile, con el objetivo de acudir su siembra para que la producción de chile cada vez aumente más,  sus metas próximas es poder cancelar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro
texts.en:
Sixty-five year old Francisco hails from the rural community of Boquerón, on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He is married and has 6 grown children.  He is a farmer and has made his living planting chillies for 10 years.  He plants his crop on a piece of land that was given to him, and has increased his landholdings little by little with great effort and hard work, in order to expand his planting area.

When he is not growing chillies, he makes his living planting corn in order to increase his earnings and get a better income.  He sells his chili harvest in Managua, where they give him a good price.

He is in need of financing to buy manure, fuel for his irrigation generator, and fertilizers, and to pay for labor for sowing his chili crop, with the aim of increasing his chili production with each crop.  His next goal is to be able to repay the loan in order to apply for another one.

loans.use: to buy manure, fuel for the irrigation generator, and fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ruben De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rubén de los Ángeles un hombre de 46 años de edad, soltero y padre de cinco hijos de 26, 25, 20, 10 y 9 años de edad, los dos menores son estudiantes de la escuela primaria. Este micro empresario es contratista y junto a su equipo de trabajo se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería y soldadura, trabajo que realiza desde muy joven. Solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras dentro de su vivienda, estas incluyen levantamiento de paredes y construcción de techo, desde que logro adquirir la vivienda tenía planes de realizar este proyecto pero se había visto imposibilitado por la falta ingresos. Rubén cuenta con el completo apoyo de sus hijos mayores quienes ya son independientes. Para realizar las reformas comprará bloques, cemento, zinc, entre otros materiales de construcción. Su mayor sueño es terminar de remodelar su vivienda.Rubén está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva que le han brindando apoyo para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rubén de los Ángeles is 46 years old, single, and the father to five children who are 9, 10, 20, 25, and 26 years old.  The two youngest are students at primary school.  This small businessman is a contractor.  Together with his team, he does masonry and welding jobs.  He has done this work since he was young.  

He is asking for this loan to make improvements inside his home, including putting up walls and constructing ceilings.  Since he got the house, he had plans to do this project, but it seemed impossible because of a lack of funds.  Rubén has the support of his older children who are already independent.  

To make the repairs, he will purchase blocks, cement, zinc, and other construction materials.  His dream is to finish remodeling his home.  Rubén is very grateful to Kiva investors who are providing support in order to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as blocks, cement, and zinc to improve his home.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa vive junto a su hija, su nieto, y su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y también comercia de forma ambulante, es muy conocida por las personas del lugar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todos saben que  lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al alcance de los clientes; María es una mujer comprometida, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde ya que todas sus compras son al contado por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Maria Luisa tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable se siente agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Luisa lives together with her daughter, her nephew, and her mother in her own home. She sells clothing for women, gentlemen and children - shirts, pants, dresses, and skirts, among other items. She has been in business for several years and this has given her much experience which allows her to obtain the best profits. 

The business is located in her home and she also sells as an itinerant saleswoman. She is very well-known by the people of the locale. She has acquired herself much clientele since everyone knows that what she sells is of quality, at accessible prices and with an unequaled service always to the order and available to the customers. 

María is a committed woman, dedicated to her work and very much a go-getter. She strives day to day to the maximum in order to make herself a better life and a great success for the future. 

In the last weeks the demand increased and she wants to make the most of it with a new investment, but she does not have enough capital that supports her since all her purchases are for cash. Because of this she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which allows her to buy clothing wholesale. 

María Luisa has good payment references and an irreproachable moral. She feels grateful for the support, sure that she will be able to settle the debt and at the same time has the hope that she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru: Муаттар работает в кондитерском цехе. Она не только изготавливает сладости, но и  контролирует производство и качество изготовленных булочек, печений, заварных и тортов. Муаттар очень трудолюбивая и к тому же умелая хозяйка, мастерица на все руки. Её ежемесячный доход направлен на обучение двоих детей и ежедневные расходы, а муж своим доходом обеспечивает питание и обувание своей семьи.  Несмотря на   не очень большой доход она старается создать хорошие условия для развития и обучения своих детей. С этими целями несколько лет тому назад она обратилась за кредитом в МДО «Арванд» и  вот уже который раз она приобретает кредит и обустраивает своё жильё. Также и теперь она хочет  получить очередной кредит для приобретения бытовой техники для дома. Муаттар старается  делать всё, чтобы её дети не нуждались не в чем и  выросли грамотными людьми. Как говорит сама Муаттар, «благодаря  поддержке от Арванд я смогу как то создать хорошие условия для своих детей и построить им хорошее будущее». Она искренне благодарит МДО «Арванд» и  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Muattar works in a sweets shop. She not only makes sweets, but also controls the production and quality of prepared scones, pastries, custards, and cakes. Muattar is a very hardworking and also skillful hostess, a mistress of all trades. Her monthly income is directed at educating her two children and daily expenses, and her husband's income covers food and clothing for the family. Despite not being a very large income, she tries to create a good environment for the development and education of her children. 

With these goals, she applied for a loan a few years ago from MDO Arvand and now once again is getting a loan to equip her household. She now wants to get another loan for the purchase of household appliances. 

Muattar tries to do everything such that her children will not need for anything and will grow into literate people. As Muattar herself says, «Thanks to the support from Arvand, I can create a good environment for my children and build them a good future." She sincerely thanks MDO Arvand also for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of 20 farmers in Bungoma District represented by Joseph. The group has three women and seven men.  Joseph is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Joseph's first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and plans to use increased profits to send his children to school and to buy his son a plot of land.

Joseph managed to harvest two bags of maize on 1 1/2 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Joseph’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Rachael is 39 years old and living happily with her five children. From the growth of her cereals business, Rachael bought a second-hand motorbike which she uses for her transportation business, which has been operating for one year. She is getting a monthly income of KES 8,000.

With this second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, she intends to purchase eight bags of dry maize for her cereals business and purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike.  

The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and plough back into her businesses. She hopes to own a grinding machine and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase eight bags of dry maize and spare parts for her motorbike repair

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer, 27 years old, is married and blessed with three children. They are currently residing at the village of Napaccu Grande. She owns and operates a food production business, specifically selling frozen foods such as hot dogs, hams, and cured pork, in this business, she earns a net income amounting to PHP 8,000 a month. She would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase frozen food products to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food products to sell

loans.name: Faulu B Group

texts.en:
Wilson’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Wilson is pictured on the right of Faulu B Group with his hand raised. Wilson is pictured among the three men and seven women of his group.  He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Wilson is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and learn new methods of planting maize.

Wilson described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, invest in livestock, and make bricks. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Wilson’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Virginia is engaged in a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and sugar.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for five years.  She hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and sugar.

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Prak is a 48-year-old mother of seven children, four of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice for thirty years. She is able to earn about KHR 12,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Prak has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The past loan has helped her to better support her family’s living conditions. 

Now, she is leading her group of three (Prak's Group) to ask for a loan. Prak will use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile draining, sewage, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad,  originaria de la Comarca llamadas las Canoas, en las afueras de Teustepe, casada, madre de 3  hijos entre las edades de 3, 6 y 13 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al  negocio de molino  y alquiler de sillas,  mesas plásticas. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven trabajando en una empresa, la cual fue ahorrando dinero poco a poco y fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de servicios de molino, la cual también se dedica a alquiler de sillas y mesas, con  préstamos  financieros que le dio una institución, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y su marido quien le administra el negocio del molino. También recibe otros ingresos de familiares que están en el extranjero. 
 En esta ocasión  Ana esta  requiriendo  el financiamiento para  comprar  sillas, mesas. ya que estima que este  crédito le  ayudaría a  comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ganancias,  para pagar el crédito y luego volver a solicitar otro, una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and originally from the Canoas region in the outskirts of Teustepe.  She is married and has three children who are 3, 6, and 13 years old.  She works as a retailer.  She has a mill and she also rents plastic tables and chairs.  She started working very young at a business and saved money little by little.  From there, she decided to start her own business providing mill services.  She also rents tables and chairs.  

She has received loans from the institution and also counts on the support of her husband and her daughter, who runs the mill business.  She also receives income from relatives who live abroad.  

Ana is requesting this loan to purchase tables and chairs.  She says that this loan will help her to purchase everything she needs for her business and allow her to provide better service to her customers.  She hopes to increase her income to repay the loan and later return to request another.  One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus tíos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tahuantinsuyo  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel de Técnico Superior en Mecánica y Electricidad en la Escuela Industrial Pedro Domingo Murillo de la ciudad de La Paz, ahora tiene su propio taller en la zona de Villa Tunari en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material (pinzas, llaves inglesas, cables) para arreglar motores y hacer cableado de vehículos en su taller.

El sueño de Juan Carlos es tener un taller que realicé todo tipo de trabajo automotriz.

Es la Segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is single and has no children; he lives with his aunt and uncle in their house located in the city of El Alto’s Tahuantinsuyo zone.  He completed upper technical level of education in auto mechanics and electricity at the Pedro Domingo Murillo Industrial School in the city of La Paz.  He now has his own auto repair shop in the city of El Alto’s Villa Tunari zone.  He needs the loan to buy supplies (pliers, wrenches, cables) to repair engines and wiring in cars in his shop.  His dream is to have a shop able to do all types of car repairs.  This is his second IMPRO loan request and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tools and cables to repair engines and electrical wiring in cars.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 36 years old and a businessman and a farmer. He is married to Jane and blessed with two children. 

Elias has been operating a public service vehicle as his primary business and farming as his secondary business for the past six years. He earns a monthly income of KES 90,000, which he uses to provide for his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by KADET staff.  Elias will use the loan to buy farm inputs like manure, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

With the anticipated profit from the businesses, he will expand his business and improve the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams are to purchase his own public service vehicle with the help of KADET.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Sokthou's Group

texts.en:
Sokthou is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a 25-year-old married father of two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. 

Sokthou has struggled to feed his children by farming rice, raising chickens and working for others for a fee, while his wife sells grocery items. The current business earns his family about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sokthou is just with VisionFund this cycle. He is now leading his group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokthou is going to use his portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. He'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. 

He hopes that this loan will enable his family to have a clean latrine for daily use so as to improve and have a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es Casada y tiene una hija, vive en casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio, la cocina y el baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, donde se encuentran en la calle vive poca luz por las noches.

Actualmente trabaja de viajando y acomodando ropa de todo tipo que  comercializa por las diferentes zonas.  Su trabajo es independiente trabajando actualmente en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, sostiene a su familia con el pago de los servicios, comida y educación de su hija, el esposo trabaja en el interior del país.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar más mercadería(ropa de todo tipo) ya que cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo con el cual tiene poco movimiento en su mercadería, y así el crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y  la tercera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Irma is married and has a daughter. She lives in her own home with one floor and a bedroom, kitchen and bathroom.  The building is made of adobe and the floor of cement. The house is located in Tembladerani in the city of La Paz, in a street without much street lighting at night.

Irma currently works traveling and collecting all kinds of clothing which she sells in different areas. She is self employed, and works in Tembladerani in the city of La Paz at the moment. She supports her family by paying for food, bills, and her daughter's education. Her husband works in the interior of the country.

She needs this loan to buy more merchandize (all kinds of clothing), because she has very little working capital which means that she does not sell much merchandize. The loan will help her to increase her earnings. 

This is the fifth time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and the third from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of clothing for men and women to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 43, lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children. For the last 25 years, Thy has been farming rice while her husband supplements the income by working as a motor taxi driver in the local area. The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 1,000 KHR after daily expenses. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. 
Thy is in her first microloan with VisionFund while the other member has been with VisionFund for two loans. As the leader, Thy is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Дилафрузу 37 лет. Она добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Дилафруз с детства всегда мечтала быть успешной бизнес леди и всегда стремится осуществлять эту заветную мечту.
Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 17, 16 и 8 лет. Ее муж занимается услугой мастера по ремонту дома и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Дилафруз   решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is 37 years old. She is a kind and determined woman. Since childhood, Dilafruz has always dreamed of being a successful business lady and always strives to implement this cherished dream. 

She is married and has three children, aged 8, 16 and 17. Her husband is engaged in home repair services and receives a small salary. This salary is not enough to provide the family with all the required means. Dilafruz decided to help her husband for the benefit of the family. 

With this goal, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now, she can thoroughly start her own business and become successful in this sphere. She wants to start a livestock business. 

From the revenue earned, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food. She is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 47 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has two sons. Thy and her husband have made a living by farming rice and planting taro for 29 years. The current business earns her about 9,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support the family. 
 
Thy has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other group members are just starting with VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Thy, the leader, is going to use her portion to buy materials such as a latrine bowl, tile and sewage draining, etc., to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as a latrine bowl, tile and sewage draining, etc, to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en San Jacinto, municipio del Departamento de Bolivar, al cual viajará, ropa para damas, sombreros, mochilas alusivas al carnaval de Barranquilla, aprovechando que la temporada se acerca y dará a su clientela justamente lo que ellos necesitan, para que lo disfruten bailando al son de la cumbia y el mapalé. Con su anterior credito le fue muy bien porque compró juguetes, ropa y electrodomésticos logrando aprovechar el potencial de ofertas del fin de año y la ciuculación de dinero en cada uno de sus clientes, por eso está muy agradecido con sus finaciadores.
texts.en:
David is applying for a new credikiva so he can travel to San Jacinto in the Department of Bolivar Municipality to buy women's clothing, hats and Baranquilla carnival themed backpacks. 

He will take advantage of the approaching Carnival season and give his clientele exactly what they need so that they enjoy dancing the cumbia and the mapalé.

He did very well with his last loan. He bought toys, clothes and appliances which allowed him to take advantage of end of year sales and circulating money through to all of his customers. 

He is very thankful to his financiers.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, hats and Baranquilla carnival themed backpacks.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is engaged in a fruits and vegetables wholesale trade. He buys the merchandise using his car in the Republic of Georgia and from villages of Ararat region.  

The main part of the goods he sells to retailers. The other part he sells in small shops in Vanadzor city. Garnik's mother from time to time helps him in trading. This activity he has performed for more than five years.

Garnik is 30 years old. He is married and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife, son and mother. Trading is the only source of family income, and with the profit from trading, Garnik solves his family needs, pays all bills for the flat, etc.
  
Garnik is seeking a 500,000 Armenian Drams loan to buy and resell citruses and tropical fruits from the Republic of Georgia.

loans.use: To buy and resell citruses and tropical fruits.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is 34 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is single, with four children between 5 months and 15 years old. Only three live at home and are in school. 

Miatta stopped her education at ninth grade and, for ten years now, she has been selling lappa (fabric) around her community. She started her business by selling dough (bread), with small money from her mother, and she learned this trade from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий живет в Каменке, в своем доме; он женат, есть один сын, который учится в школе. Вот уже 8 лет как
Юрий занимается выращиванием овощей на своем земельном участке. Он выращивают помидоры, редис и огурцы.

Недавно был сильный ветер, на одной из теплиц сильно погнуло дуги, теперь нужно их менять. Для этого Юрию нужны дополнительные средства. Также Юрий хочет улучшить систему отопления в теплице, чтобы получать более ранний урожай. У Юрия есть еще один земельный участок, где он хочет строить еще теплицы, но уже в следующем году.
texts.en:
Yuriy lives in Kamenka in his own house. He is married and has one son who goes to school. Yuriy has been cultivating vegetables on his own plot of land for eight years now. He grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers.

Just recently there was a strong win and on one of the greenhouses the arches got bent and need to be replaced. Yuriy needs additional money to do this. Also Yuriy wants to improve the heating system in the greenhouse so he can collect an earlier harvest. He has one more plot of land where he wants to build additional greenhouses, but in the next year.

loans.use: to repair the greenhouse and install a heating system.

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesus

texts.es: Yolanda de 34 años de edad habita junto  a su familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y siempre lo que más le ha importado es brindar lo mejor para vivir en condiciones estables por ella y su familia, es muy conocida por sus vecinos por ser trabajadora y en la actualidad tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende verduras y flores diferentes estilos a precios muy convenientes y accesibles para el público. Yolanda desea incrementar más sus ventas teniendo mejores productos es por eso que decidió acercarse a INTEGRAL y solicitar un crédito para poder comprar flores, diferentes colores y tipos y también comprar verduras como papas, güisquil, cilantro, rábano etc. Espera y confía en que pronto cumplirá su sueño de tener una vida con mejores condiciones para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 34, lives with her family. She is a very entrepreneurial woman and the most important thing to her has always been to work towards more stable living conditions for her and her family. 

She is well known by her neighbors for being hard working. Currently she has a small stall where she sells vegetables and different types of flowers at very reasonable prices that are accessible to the public. 

Yolanda wants to increase her sales by having better products. 

This is why she approached INTEGRAL and is requesting a loan in order to buy different types and colored flowers as well as vegetables such as potatoes, chayote, cilantro, radishes etc. 

She hopes and is believes that soon her dream of having a better life for her and her family will come true.

loans.use: to buy different types and colored flowers as well as vegetables such as potatoes, chayote, cilantro, radishes etc.

loans.name: Bulondo B Group

texts.en:
Francis is a member of Bulondo B Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers: 11 women and 1 man. Francis is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Francis first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Francis reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about four bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested seven bags per 1/2 acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Francis’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий занимается выращивание овощей в теприцах. Он использовал предыдущий КИВА кредит для закупки пленки и семян. В результате удачного сезона Юрий смог улучшить свои жилищные условия - сделать ремонт в ванной комнате и установить туалет в доме (до этого туалет был только на улице). Также он купил котел для отопления теплиц.

В этот раз Юрию нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы построить еще одну теплицу для рассады и подключить систему отопления. Благодаря этому Юрий сможет раньше посадить семена и раньше собрать урожай, который можно продать по более высокой цене.
texts.en: Yuriy earns a living by growing vegetables in greenhouses. He used his previous Kiva loan to purchase plastic covering and seeds. As a result of his successful season, he was able to improve his living conditions by renovating his bathroom and installing a toilet in his house (prior to that, the toilet was outside.) He also bought a boiler to heat the greenhouses. This time, Yuriy needs supplementary financial resources to build one more greenhouse for seedlings and to connect the heating system. This will allow him to plant seeds and harvest the produce earlier, which will enable him to sell the vegetables at a more profitable price.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for seedlings and to connect the heating system

loans.name: Victorious E Group

texts.en:
Victorious E is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Benard. The group has 7 women and 3 men. Benard is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum.

Benard joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Benard joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school. Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Benard was able to harvest only 1.5 bags of maize per half-acre. After joining One Acre Fund, during the Long Rains 2012 he was able to harvest 6 bags per half-acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future.

Benard’s group members will each receive input loans for ½ acre, for the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for five acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Victorious H Group

texts.en:
Victorious H Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of eight women and three men led by Thomas, pictured on the right with his hand raised. 

Thomas is receiving an input loan for 0.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Thomas joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Thomas joined One Acre Fund, so that he could gain access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Thomas described his last year's harvest as good, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. 

Victorious H Group members will each receive input loans of 0.5 acres during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 41 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in rice farming business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Rosenda is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy  feritlizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this loan, she will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest. In the future, Rosenda hopes to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 36 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, por cuestión de bajos recursos económicos en su hogar, alcanzó a terminar la escuela primaria sin oportunidad de llegar a ser bachiller y mucho menos profesional, viéndose frustrados muchos de sus sueños. Vive en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra. Sandra reside en la Parroquia Puerto Limón de este cantón, un sector que fue habitado por una comunidad tsáchila hace muchos años y tiene varios atractivos turísticos. Además los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Sandra siendo muy pequeña ayudaba a sus padres a criar pollos y gallinas para la posterior venta, terminando la escuela se dedicaba a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar y también a cuidar a los animales. Con este aprendizaje, Sandra hace 2 años empezó el negocio por sí sola y también atiende un local de venta de balanceado en un pequeño espacio de su casa. Dedica a este negocio 8 horas cada día. Sandra siempre ha tenido objetivos y metas altos, es por eso que ella ahora necesita ampliar su negocio de venta de balanceado y crianza de pollos, acudiendo de alguna forma a la herramienta de publicidad y así incrementar sus ingresos y tener realización personal. Es por esto que solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos que sean necesarios. Fundación Alternativa le brindó la atención oportuna y ágil que ella necesitaba y que no había obtenido anteriormente. Sandra agradece su participación en la obtención de sus sueños en cualquier parte del mundo en donde usted se encuentre.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 36 year old woman. She is single and has no children. Due to poor economic resources at home she was only able to finish elementary school without the opportunity to graduate from high school and even less to get a professional degree leaving her frustrated because she has not accomplished many of her dreams. 

She lives in the district of Santo Domingo in the Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas province. 
Santo Domingo connects the Ecuadorian mountain region with the coastal region. It is a city which has turned into the commerical axis with several growing sectors. As proof it has several entrepreneurial families that a few years ago started with small businesses. Studies show that a majoriity of the businesses started empirically and have grown due to tourists, business people and travelers moving from one region to the other. 

Sandra lives in the Puerto Limón parish in this district. This sector was inhabited by a Tsáchila community many years ago and has several tourist attractions. Also, a majority of the inhabitants of this parish work in agriculture and livestock.  

Since she was very little Sandra helped her parents to raise chickens and hens for sale. After school she would help her mother with chores around the house as well as taking care of the animals. 

With this training Sandra started her own business two years ago. She also takes care of a small feed selling business out of her home. She spends eight hours a day on this business. 

Sandra has always had high expectations and goals. This is why she now wants to expand her feed and chicken raising business. She wants to use some form of advertisement and in this way increase her income and gain personal fulfillment. 

She is requesting this loan to buy the necessary supplies.


Fundación Alternativa gave her the attention that she needed and has not been able to get before. 

Sandra is thankful for everyone around the world who is helping her dreams come true.

loans.use: to expand her feed and chicken raising business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, who is 24 years old, lives in the Sagarejo District with her husband and infant child. Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural start-up business, but with no success. Her loan request was rejected each time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The income for the family comes from an animal husbandry business. Specifically, they own pigs and sell the pork and piglets seasonally. As well, Nino’s husband transports wood from the forest that he sells to the villagers, but their income is hardly enough to feed a three-member family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides for business start-ups and re-startups. It has credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income.

With the received credit, Nino will purchase two milk cows which she will house in an old, empty farm building located in the yard. Nino will work hard on the farm and will sell milk in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Victorious G Group

texts.en:
Victorious G group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Margaret, the group's representative, is pictured on the right of Victorious G Group, with her hand raised. The group is comprised of the two men and eight women pictured here. Margaret will receive inputs on credit, sufficient to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use her increased profits to send her children to school. Margaret describes her last year's harvest as good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Margaret’s group will receive a total of five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Bulondo H Group

texts.en:
Hansan is a member of Bulondo H Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with ten One Acre Fund farmers, six women and four men. Hansan is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Hansan first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Hansan joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Hansan was only able to harvest six bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 13 bags per ½ acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and invest in cows. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Hansan’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has 8 school-aged and adult children. Melba owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month. In 2011, Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situations and her ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting a new loan of 5,000PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in more goods

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with seven children between the ages of 2 and 22 years old. Only six of the children are attending school and live at home. She did not attend grade school but she was able to attend a vocation school. She is very good at managing her home affairs. For the past three years, she has been making and selling local soap in her community and market.  She spends four hours making the soap and she spends five hours to distribute the soap to her customers in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of making local soap from a school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic, oil, and wood for her business. In the near future, she would like to have a car.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic, oil, and woods to make soap

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 25 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single and has two children who are five and eight years old. Her children attend school and they all live at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells artificial hair. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to sell

loans.name: Faulu Group

texts.en:
Norisis is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Faulu Group members. The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Norisis first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Norisis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, access the best input prices, and have inputs delivered prior to planting time.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Norisis was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, he was able to harvest 5 bags per ½ acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Norisis’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is a single woman with 5 children between the ages of 5 to 13. They all live at home and her children are in school. For 4 years now she has been selling fish and oil at the local market. She started this business, which was given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and oil for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and oil for her business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 21 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is single with a four-month-old child. She is also a grade eleven student. For three years now, she has been selling soap at the local market. She started this business, which was given to her by her mother, and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 56 years old, with 3 children, from Dalarik village of Armavir region and is involved in agriculture. He keeps two cows, gets milk and uses it in cheese production. Then he sells the cheese in a local market and gets income which helps him to cover his family's basic costs. But for a family of five, this income is hardly enough for making ends meet.

So, Samvel has applied for this loan to expand his farm. The loan will help him to purchase two cows, an ox and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Samvel to increase the livestock, gather a high income and secure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows, an ox and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Natundwe Group

texts.en:
Natundwe is a group of 14 farmers, 10 women and 4 men, in Bungoma South District represented by Charles, on the right of the photo with his hand raised. He will receive farming inputs on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Charles joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Charles joined One Acre Fund so that he could benefit from new farming techniques and grow enough food for the family.

Charles reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 14 bags per 1/2 acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. Charles’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, for a group total of 7 acres of maize and sorghum. The field officer is standing on the far left of the photo in a yellow T-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in new equipment and tools

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 24-year-old mother of two kids. Her husband is a governmental officer.

Suhair has a small shop where she sells clothes that she gets from a free-zone market at wholesale prices.  She is applying for a youth loan to get more styles of clothes.

loans.use: to get more styles of clothes.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman lives in the Sagarejo District. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife, child, brother, sister and sister-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Telman works as an artisan and earns a monthly income.  Several times, Telman has requested loans from local credit providers, but his loan requests are always rejected because of the lack of experience in the new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the received credit, Telman will start a canteen in his village. He will purchase dishes and renovate the space where he will start the business. Telman hopes his business will be profitable and that he will attract many customers since there is no similar canteen nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Telman will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start a canteen

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra, 59 years old, is widowed. She supports her two sons from the income she makes selling blankets, kitchenware, appliances and olive oil, based on the demand and the season. Yusra is now concentrating on selling blankets and warm bed covers. She is applying for a loan to increase her quantity of blankets.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of blankets.

loans.name: Elvard

texts.en:
Elvard is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of Agara with his family: his father (retired), his wife and 5-year-old daughter. The income source for the family is the retirement pension of Elvard’s father and a small monthly salary earned by Elvard’s wife working as a teacher locally. 

Elvard is involved in agricultural business. In particular, he owns beehives with bee colonies and sells honey seasonally. Elvard owns agricultural land but he didn’t have financial resources for seasonal agricultural work and plowing. Now his loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Elvard will plow the land and purchase potato seeds. He will sow it and work hard on the plot during the spring season. After properly done seasonal work, Elvard will get a good harvest in summer. He will sell harvested products to local retailers. The income of the family will increase. 

Elvard plans to save some funds for sowing more potatoes next year. The living conditions of the family will improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and cultivate his land

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 57 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been engaged with her business over 20 years, and earns 7,000PHP. Elsa joined GDMPC in 2011. Elsa is requesting a loan of 9,500PHP to purchase additional fish, shrimp, and crab. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena is 55 years old and has five children. They all live in the northwest part of the country. 

She has been selling milk and baby calves to locals for almost twenty years. Prena is happy with the profit she’s been generating from the activity, yet “it’s very exhausting,” she said. “I have to milk the cows every morning and evening and then in the mornings, I must take the milk to every client. And this is a daily routine that has been going on for all these past twenty years,” she added. 

Prena now wants to improve her animals’ living conditions and is applying for a loan to build a new stable. The amount she is requesting is a total amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to improve her animals' living conditions by building a new stable for them

loans.name: Umoja Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his mid-20s, is single. He has been running several businesses selling telephone accessories and airtime for the phones. He works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Charles' 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy another computer, office chairs and office tables, and to pay rent and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy more telephone accessories like housing and batteries for phones and air time for the phones. He has a dream of making his business bigger than it is now.

Charles will share this loan with his group "Umoja Kigogo", with 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy housing, batteries and more airtime for phones.

loans.name: Victorious B Group

texts.en:
Victorious B group is comprised of 13 farmers, 8 women and 5 men, in Bungoma South District. Alice, the group's representative, is pictured with the rest of the group, on the right with her hand raised. Alice will receive, on credit, farming inputs sufficient to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Alice joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2007, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could get good training on farming and grow enough food for the family.

Alice reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 1.5 bags of maize per half-acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 7 bags per half-acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, and to invest in cows. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alice’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each.  In total, Victorious B group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband works in the wholesale distribution business. They have 5 sons and daughters. Using her husband’s expertise, she gets blankets and clothes to sell at her house at a higher price to neighbors and friends. Now Abla is applying for a loan to obtain more blankets and winter clothing items to increase her profits.

loans.use: to get more blankets and winter clothing items.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 57-year-old mother of a son and a daughter who goes to the university. To be able to pay for her daughter’s university fees, Siham opened a clothing shop for which she wants to enhance its decoration and bring in a new collection of clothes. That's why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring a new collection of clothes to her clothing shop

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita, this 35-year-old lady, is married and has three young children who are 12, 8 and 4 years old. They live in a little coastal village in northeastern Albania.

In addition to looking after her young children, she has been buying fruits and veggies from people in her village and selling them in some town markets. “It is not that I earn a big income from this activity maybe, but it is something; and it is some sort of help for people of my village as well. So, it works both ways,” Merita said.

Merita is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek to buy more inventories to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of fruits and veggies to sell

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en: Hashem is a 20-year-old single man living with his seven siblings. Hashem is a university student majoring in gymnastic and sports education. He is applying for an educational loan to help with paying for his fees next semester.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en: Fathi is a 19-year-old single guy, and he has three younger brothers. Fathi is a second-year student majoring in Computer Networking. He is now applying for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah is a 38-year-old conservative woman (her husband took her place in the photo). The two have a medium-sized food market that she works at during the day while her husband is working on his cab. In the afternoons she goes to look after their daughter and three sons and he stays at the shop. Now Kefah has applied for a loan to enhance their shop by allowing them to obtain new snack stands and add more food products.

loans.use: obtain new snacks stands and add more food products.

loans.name: Helal

texts.en: Helal is a 20-year-old man who has one brother and one sister. After their father passed away, Helal start working in different part-time jobs to be able to make a living and pay his university fees. He is now applying for an educational loan to help him pay the rest of the fees so he can register for the next semester.

loans.use: pay the rest of his university fees

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 54 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. Annie is married and has four children, ages 17 to 32 years. Only one lives at home and is in school. Annie was not fortunate enough to attend school.

Annie has been involved in business for the past 21 years, and presently she is selling food items, such as salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato, in the local market. She started this business with 5,000 LRD given to her by her mother, and she learned this trade from her, also. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato, for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell, such as salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in agriculture for 10 years already.  She keeps 10 chickens and owns an agricultural plot of land where pear and apricot trees are grown. She works hard to gather a good harvest, as her main income comes from selling the harvested produce in local markets.

Anahit also owns a greenhouse which is old and needs to be renovated. She has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and polyethylene covers for her greenhouse. This will enable her to improve her greenhouse and start the cultivation of tomatoes.

Anahit lives in Dimitrov village of Ararat region with her husband and three children. It is very important for Anahit to gather a good harvest and earn high income so she is able to sustain her family and cover her children's basic costs.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds and polyethylene covers for greenhouse

loans.name: Gjystina

texts.en:
Gjystina is 52 years old, married, and has six children, the youngest of whom is 12 years old. They live in the northeast of Albania. In the region where they reside, there are power outages all the time, and flooding as well. While last year, their region was covered in snow that brought severe loss in almost every household, this year they are suffering from flooding. Despite all the struggles caused by weather conditions, Gjystina has been operating an agricultural business for almost nine years. 

“With all the hard work, I would have probably secured a better life for all of us; yet, after all the extreme weather events, at least I can bring the basics for my family,” she said.  “I want to build a stable now for the animals, because I have been sheltering them at my neighbors' place during these past cold and rainy months,” Gjystina added.

loans.use: To build a stable for her animals

loans.name: Kongoni Youth Group

texts.en:
Titus is a member of the Kongoni Youth Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers - 4 women and 6 men. Titus is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Titus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 long rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. Titus joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best training in agriculture and grow enough food for his family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Titus was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the 2012 long rains, he was able to harvest 13 bags per half acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, and invest in cows. For the 2013 long rains season, Titus’ group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 41-year-old mother of four sons. Her husband has recently retired from the military and is now working as a driver to be able to support his family. Amal helps in adding another source of income from selling baby pampers. Now she is applying for a loan to start selling detergents and cleaning products and to have variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to start selling detergents and cleaning products.

loans.name: Khairyah

texts.en: Khairyah is a 49-year-old widow who is looking after her 5 sons. From her tailoring business she was able to put food on the table for the family and pay for the household bills. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 40, is divorced and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Nga has been running a general store in front of her house for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products such as cooking oils and soft drinks to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different products such as cooking oils and soft drinks to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tree farm supplies such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

loans.name: Sheela

texts.en:
Sheela is a 29-year-old differently-able lady living with her parents in the village of Balipatna in Odisha, India. She is engaged in the activity of making incense sticks, and she sells these sticks directly to the shopkeepers in the market. She started this business four years back when her family's economic condition was not good and her father was overburdened with family responsibility.

She has a plan to expand her business of making incense sticks by making them in large quantity and supplying them to the big dealers. She also wants to give training in making incense sticks to the girls of her village to make them self-employed.

She has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags, etc. She has a dream of running a training school for making incense sticks and supporting her father economically.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags etc. for her incense sticks business.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita de 38 años de edad habita junto a su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su trabajo. Actualmente posee una tortillería ya que con esfuerzo sea superado ante las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado y gracias a ellos e su hogar nunca ha faltado el pan de cada día. Ana desea ampliar más su negocio es decir comprar mas suministros que le permitan tener su negocio mas rentable es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamos para comprar maíz, aceite, manteca entre otros para que los clientes queden satisfechos y siempre mantenga esa clientela que tiene. Ella espera que la ayuda sea recibida y que pronto su calidad de vida mejore con forme vayan pasando los días.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita is 38 years old and lives with her family.  She is a hardworking and honest woman who is responsible with her work.  Currently she has a tortilla business.  She has overcome adversities in life with effort and thanks to them, her household has never gone without its daily bread.  

Ana wants to expand her business and purchase more supplies that will allow her to have a more profitable business.  This is why she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase corn, oil, butter, and other items.  She wants her customers to stay satisfied and always maintain the customers she has.  She hopes that she will receive help and that soon her quality of life will improve as time goes on.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, butter, and other items.

loans.name: Kabi Prasad

texts.en:
Kabi Prasad is a 28-year-old differently-able person living with his uncle and aunt in a small village named Balipatna of Odisha, India. He owns and manages a variety cum betel store, and he has this shop for the past four years. He sells biscuits, hair oil, biscuits, toothbrushes, betel, tobacco, incense sticks, talcum powder, chocolates and other daily household consumables in his shop. 

He has a plan to expand his business by adding more stock of what he sells and a few new products like detergents, soap, hair oil, shampoo, wafers, etc. to his shop inventory. He says that doing so will help him increase his monthly income and fulfill his family's daily requirements.

Kabi Prasad has applied for a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing the above-mentioned items.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing detergents, soap, hair oil, shampoo, wafers etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 42-year-old mother of three boys and a daughter. Ibtisam has a home business selling clothes and home products and appliances. Recently she added shelves to help her organize the goods she has. Now she is applying for a loan to increase the quantity and add selling cosmetics and make up products.

loans.use: to add selling cosmetics and make up products to her business.

loans.name: Hemanta Ku

texts.en:
Hemanta Ku is a 38-year-old differently-able person living with his wife and a child in a village of Khurda District in Odisha, India. He is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products in his village and the market near his village. He has three cows in his dairy farm. He has 10 years of experience in this business.

He has a plan to purchase one more cow and renovate the shed for his cattle. This would help him in generating more income and make his family financially strong.

Hemanta Ku has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing one more cow and renovating the shed for his cattle. He has a dream to let his child study in a good school and save some money for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing one more cow and to renovate the shed for his cattle.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai, 38 years old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. His wife helps to support their family through the income she earns from working as a bookkeeper. Tai is a barber and began his barber's shop twelve years ago. They all live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tai intends to take a loan to buy barber's tools and equipment, such as dryers and razors. The additional tools will enable him to increase his sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy barber's tools and equipment, such as dryers and razors

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in a small house, in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a laborer in a nearby company. Trinh runs a business of selling rices, to earn a living. 

She started her business 22 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different kinds of rices, to resell to her customers. Trinh hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different kinds of rices, to resell to her customers

loans.name: Primas De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de colchones, venta de canastas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de trenzas, venta de café y api.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irene es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (elaboración de canastas); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace 47 años y en la actualidad lo sigue realizando como fuente de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de plantas para el trenzado) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas al Lago Titicaca y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Primas de Huayna Potosi community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has six members and is headed by a board where Irene is the president.  The members of the group do different types of work: making mattresses, selling baskets, purchase and sales of livestock, sale of braids, and sale of coffee and apí [non-alcoholic maize drink]. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit small businesses like Irene's.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and joined by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a craft business making baskets.  She learned this business from her parents 47 years ago and continues to do it as her work.  

Irene will use the loan they are requesting to purchase plants to braid baskets.  She will purchase the plants in communities close to Lake Titicaca and later make the baskets to sell at her permanent sales location.  This type of work allows her to earn enough income to support her household.  She is married and has five children.

Irene says that the thing she likes best about Pro Mujer is the savings.

loans.use: to purchase plants to braid baskets.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 48, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband earns a living working as a driver.

Thanh has been running a general store and food stall in front of her house for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products such as milk, confectionery items, dishes and spoons to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different products such as milk, confectionery items, dishes and spoons to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hermín Vladimir

texts.es:
Hermín es un joven emprendedor de 26 años de edad, que sueña con poder llegar a convertirse en un gran abogado, Su familia es de origen campesina y de un estrato socioeconómico bajo, por lo cual su sueño ingresar a la universidad se truncó y se vio en la necesidad de laborar para comenzar su carrera. 
En la actualidad trabaja diariamente de cuatro de la mañana a dos de la tarde como independiente, produce mazamorra, la cual prepara desde su casa y comercializa en los diferentes barrios del municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia.
Con el propósito de continuar con su gran sueño este joven se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de canecas para el transporte de su producto y compra de maíz para aumentar su producción. Espera que su situación económica mejore y poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus padres.
texts.en:
Hermín is a young entrepreneur who is 26 years old, and dreams of being able to become a great lawyer. His has a family of farmers and a low socioeconomic status, which is why his dream to enter the university has been spoiled and he sees the need to work in order to begin his career. Now he works daily from four in the morning until two in the afternoon as an independent salesperson. He produces mazamorra, a corn and milk pudding, which he prepares in his house and sells in different neighborhoods in the Santa Bárbara municipality of Colombia.

With the goal of continuing with his big dream, this young person is asking for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of large pots to transport his product in, as well as the purchase of corn to increase his production. He hopes that his economic situation will improve and be able to provide economic stability to his parents.

loans.use: to purchase large pots to prepare mazamorra (a type of pudding) and corn

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
Jaime de 63 años de edad, ha dedicado gran parte de  su vida a comerciar. Desde hace 18 años montó su propio negocio en donde comercializa productos de la canasta familiar. Esta actividad ha sido su entrada económica para el y la familia de su hermana con la que trabaja en la tienda. 
Con esta actividad ha podido construir su casa y ofrecerle a su familia un techo para vivir. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de solventar la demanda de productos exigidos por su clientela. 
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su empresa y convertirla en un mercado autoservicio, que permita mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 63 years old.  He has dedicated a large part of his life to sales.  Since he was 18, he has had his own business where he sells household items.  This work has been the financial ticket for him and his sister's family, with whom he works in the store.  This work has allowed him to build his house and offer his family a place to live.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase stock to meet his customer's demand for products.  

His dream is to see his business grow and become a self-service market, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase household items.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah is a 39-year-old, divorced woman. She is a farmer who sells blankets at home, after work, to be able to support herself. She is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of blankets and bed covers, to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of blankets and bed covers, available for sale

loans.name: Grupo 25 Gb Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO 25 GB”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brígida es la Presidenta.
