Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pipocas y ropa, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de ropa americana, tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos AVON, salón de belleza, venta de peluches.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brígida es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió después de haber estudiado esta técnica de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de secadora y cepillos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará es su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal association "Grupo 25 GB" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as a parte of the Focal Center of Germán Busch. It is made of 8 partners and is directed by a board where Brígida is the president. The businesses that the partners of the association complete are varied. Some of them are the sale of popcorn and clothes, electronics, American clothes, groceries, Avon products, beauty salons, and stuffed animals.

The loan which will finance these microentrepreneurs . As a partner, Brígida notes that it's the first time they have worked with Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of her sister who is a partner of the institution. Now she has a beauty salon business which she began after having studied the work technique.

The loan they will take out is to increase capital (to buy a hairdryer and brushes) which they will acquire in the markets of the town El Alto and afterwards she will install it in her workspace. This form of work allows her to generate more resources to maintain her family now that she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys their lessons on health and credit.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and brushes

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, age 27, is single and lives with her family in the city of Ho Chi Minh. She earns money by running a general store in front of her house. 

Ngan started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan so she can buy food and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Amazonas De Huayna Potosi Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI II”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de celulares, venta de zapatos, macramé de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de chompas, venta de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas de su grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas a macramé; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió de hace años de su Tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito; además nuestro servicio de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Amazonas de Huayna Potosi II” is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Virginia is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different business activities such as weaving blankets, selling sweaters, selling mobile phones, selling shoes, producing macramé blankets, selling clothes, and selling hardware goods.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Sra. Virginia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago after receiving an invitation from her friends in the group who are also members of the organization. At the moment, she has a business of producing macramé blankets. Virginia started this business years ago with her aunt.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she acquires at the fairs in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she uses these supplies to produce the goods that are sold to order. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Virginia is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Virginia said that she enjoys the training seminars related to health and credit issues. She also enjoys the health services provided by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Las Azucenas” que conforman 09 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 28. Julia tiene 36 años, casada con 07 hijos de la cual 03 de ellos en etapa escolar. Julia se dedica hace 20 años a la confección de ropa nueva y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Julia ha solicitado el préstamo para la compra de hilos, agujas, tela, botones. Una de las metas de Julia es poder arreglar su casa para que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida. Julia está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Kiva. Julia se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo negro.
texts.en: This is the group "Las Azucenas" (The White Lillies) which is made of nine partners who dedicate themselves to commercial activity and are passing through their 28th cycle. Julia is 36 years old, married with 7 children, three of whom are school aged. She has dedicated herself to making new clothing for the last 20 years and has loyal customers. Julia has asked for a loan to purchase thread, needles, cloth, and buttons. One of Julia's goals is to be able to fix her house so that her children can have a better quality of life. Julia is very content with this loan and grateful to Kiva. Julia is located in the back and is the third from the right side, seen in the black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase threads, needles, cloth, and buttons.

loans.name: Dora Morena

texts.es: Dora de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia sus dos hijos, Uno de ellos es especial. Gracias a Dios viven en casa propia ya que con esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más. Dora es una mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido  darlo todo por el bienestar de sus hijos es responsable, honesta, sincera y trabajadora es muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser una buena madre. Dora posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico u otros. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a los clientes ella posee de clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Lastimosamente  ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca un poco y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como: Sopas, café, maíz, frijol, Huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate u otros. La clienta cuenta con buenas referencias de pago y eso la hace que las personas depositen su confianza en ella, Confía en que Dios no la va a dejar sola y la ayuda pronto será entregada.
texts.en: Dora is 51 years old and lives together with her family and her two children, one of whom is in special education. She thanks God that they live in their own house now that they have made an effort to improve the quality of their lives little by little. Dora is a fighter whose vision has always been to give everything for the well-being of her children. She is responsible, honest, sincere, a hard worker, very friendly, and filled with pride for being a good mother. Dora has a small shop where she sells basic products and necessities like milk, eggs, toilet paper, and others. The store is located in her house and thanks to her manner of working with the clients, she has a clientele that comes to her looking to buy products every day. Unfortunately, she does not have the necessary capital to make her store grow a little, and for this reason she is asking Integral for a loan to purchase more basic materials like soups, coffees, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate, and others. The client has good references for pay and that makes people leave her loans with confidence. She has faith that God is not going to leave her alone and that soon help will be delivered.

loans.use: to buy more basic materials like soups, coffees, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate, and others.

loans.name: Marlina Stephany

texts.es:
Marlina, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por las facilidades de la institución, además de que este aporte le ayuda para mejorar el negocio, se comprara lociones, cremas, shampoo, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que su efecto con el crédito anterior fue positivo, le ayudo a mejorar en los ingresos, ha mejorado su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Marlina decided on a new loan due to the institution's easy plan. In addition to the fact that this loan will help her improve her business in purchasing lotions, creams, and shampoo, these purchases will help her to improve the selection in her business.

She says that her experience with the previous loan was positive, as it helped her to improve her earnings and has improved the level of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams and shampoo.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 24 year old single man.  He was not fortune enough to find a suitable job after getting his bachelors degree.  Since he has two younger sisters  to look after, he opened a small restaurant.  The restaurant will help the family earn income and allows Rami to switch jobs in the future.  

Rami works in his restaurant, which serves local food and sandwiches such as hummus and falafel.  He applied for a youth loan to buy new pots and ingredients.  He hopes that adding new dishes to the menu will enhance his business.

loans.use: to buy new pots and ingredients.

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is a married mother of three children. She has one son and two daughters, all of whom go to school.  She has been running a pub for three years now.  She works from 3 p.m. to midnight. She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pili's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more beverages such as beer and sodas. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more spirits and to renovate her pub. She dreams of buying another pikipiki (motorbike). 

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Mwale," which has 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more spirits and to renovate her pub.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take another loan to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell in her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Yen believes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. This will enable her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad habita junto a su hijo en casa propia, Es una mujer que toda la vida ha trabajado con buenas aspiraciones, siendo muy emprendedora y trabajadora, siempre toda la vida se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que ha dado la vida por sus hijo que siempre ha sido su mayor fuente de inspiracion. Maria tiene una pequeña tortilleria ubicada en su hogar y gracias a Dios tiene clientes quienes la prefienren ya que maneja precios accesibles y esmuy amable a la hora de vender. Maria desea inventir en la compra de insumos necesarios para seguir teniendo su tortilleria por eso ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un prestamo para comprar maiz, leña, mannteca, aceite, volteadores etc. Y confia en Dios que su credito llegara y seguira dandole la oportunidad de tener una buena vida a ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years of age, and lives with her son in her own house. She has worked all her life with high hopes for the future, and is entrepreneurial and hard-working. Throughout her life she has always given everything to provide for her son, who has been her biggest source of inspiration. 

Maria has a small tortilla business in her home, and thankfully she has customers who choose to buy from her due to her affordable prices and friendliness when selling her goods. Maria wants to buy the supplies she needs to keep her tortilla business going, and has therefore requested a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn, firewood, lard, oil, tortilla-making utensils, etc. She places her trust in God that she will receive her loan, and will continue to ensure that she and her son have the opportunity to have a good life.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lard, oil, tortilla-making utensils, etc.

loans.name: Rosas De Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE BAUTISTA”  iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de miniaturas, trenzado de mantas, venta de utensilios, venta de donas y masitas,  lavado de autos, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, taller de calzados, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de material escolar; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella vende este mismo material.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos, lápices, reglas, estuches, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y las reuniones con las amigas.
texts.en:
The group ROSES BAUTISTA (Roses of Bautista) will begin their twenty-sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American Focal Center. It consists of nine members and is directed by a board where Valeria is the Treasurer. The members of the community association conduct diverse businesses such as: selling miniatures, braided rugs, selling utensils, selling donuts and pastries, washing cars, selling clothing, corner store, cobbler, selling shoes.

The loan will benefit small businesses of which Valeria is a member. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling school supplies; she tells us that she learned the business from her mother, who sells the same things.
 
The loan she is requesting will go toward increasing capital (to buy notebooks, pencils, rulers, pencil cases, etc..) which she will acquire at the fairs in La Paz and then sell at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the credit and health training and meetings with friends.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, rulers, pencil cases, etc.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is a 53 year old married woman.  She lives with her six children, five sons and a daughter, and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns money as a driver for hire.  For twenty years, she has run a grocery store, selling vegetables to people in her community.

Hai would like a loan to purchase better quality vegetables at competitive prices from wholesalers.  She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is 35 years old and is single.  He lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

He has run a general store at his house for the past 10 years.  He sells milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery.  He intends to use his loan to buy a variety of products to sell, including eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him improve his living conditions and save money for future business investments.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell at his general store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is asking for a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and drinks, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her better meet the needs of her customers. Her last loan allowed her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and drinks, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai would like to take out a further loan to buy coffee and drinks to sell from her house. She also would like to buy more chickens, ducklings, and frogs to raise and sell. Gai's last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee and drinks to sell as well as chickens, ducklings, and frogs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh would like to take out another loan to buy beauty products to sell to her customers. Her last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan would like to take out another loan to buy construction materials to stock in her store. Her last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to stock in her store.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвел родился и живет  в городе Капан ,Сюникской области. У Самвела высшее инженерное образование,он окончил Ереванский Политехнический институт,факультет Кибернетики. После учебы он долгие годы работал инженером в Капане. 
С 2002 года  Самвел начал заниматся производством строительных материалов.
Уже 10 лет как Самвел арендовал строительное  помешение  в Капане и производит разные бетоные плитки для тратуаров. Во время многочисленных заказов Самвелу помагают родные и близкие. 
Самвелу 53 года.Он женат и имеет двух сыновей. С прибылью от его производства Самвел содержит семью, платит за учебу сына и помогает родителям пенсионерам. 
Самвелу нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для приобритения цемента и песка. Кредит поможет ему во время выполнить большой заказ Областного муниципалитета.Эта сделка принесет ему крупный  доход.
texts.en:
Samvel was born and raised in Kapan, in the Syunik region. He graduated the State Engineering University of Armenia with a degree in cybernetics and later worked as an engineer in Kapan for many years. In 2002, he started a business producing construction materials. For 10 years, he's rented a building in Kapan where he makes various concrete paving stones used in sidewalks. His family helps him run the business.

Samvel is 53 years old. He's married and he has two children. His business enables him to provide for his family, pay for his son's education and support his own pensioner parents. 

Samvel is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to purchase cement and sand. These materials will allow him to fulfill a very profitable large order placed by the regional municipality.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for his manufacturing

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is a 21-year-old, young provider of the family. He takes care of his mother, brother, and sister. Elnur's father has died and his teeny sister receives a pension from his father's job place until she will graduate. 

To improve family living conditions, he changed his plans about his own future and, four years ago, he started carpenter work. He is engaged in the manufacture of doors and windows. His brother is assisting him at the workshop he has rented. 

Elnur is a hard-working man and there are less difficulties at his work now. His desire is to take new and modern instruments and use them to produce high-quality service.

The reason Elnur has applied for the loan is to buy wooden materials to make the windows for their house. The windows are rotten now and keep the house cold in winter. He will make the windows himself at his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wooden materials to make the windows for their house.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con esposo y su  hijo. Su esposo trabaja como motorista cerca de su vivienda y ella  posee una tiendita en la cual vende diversidad de artículos tales como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas,  azúcar, aceite, detergente, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación a logrado mantenerlo activo por todo este tiempo. Cabe destacar que no tiene un trabajo fijo y se dedica a cuidar y atender en la tienda.  Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora  y responsable ya que las metas que se propone siempre las alcanza con mucho éxito. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y lograr mejorar sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. De acuerdo a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña tiendita en la compra de mercadería  como: golosinas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc. De tal forma que su tienda siempre tenga todo lo que los clientes buscan y así poder alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and child. Her husband works as a driver near their home and Maria has a small shop through which they sell diverse products such as rice, beans, sweets, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. She has spent many years dedicating herself to the business and thanks to God and her dedication she has managed to keep the business active for all of this time. It should be noted that she doesn't have fixed work and dedicates herself to caring for her store. She is characterized by being a very hard worker and above all as very enterprising and responsible now that the goals she has proposed have given her a lot of success. Her dream is to see the business flourish and to manage to improve hear earnings with the objective of improving the quality of life for herself and for her family. Due to the above, she has decided to ask for this loan from Integral to invest in her little shop for the purchase of merchandise such as sweets, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk, etc. In this war, her shop always has all of the products her clients seek and thus she can achieve her dream of improving the quality of her and her family's lives.

loans.use: compra de mercadería  como: golosinas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 33, is divorced and has two children.  She lives with her sons in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hang started a food stall five years ago.  She sells food, such as noodles and pork, to people in her community.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food and furniture for her stall.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will allow her to generate a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.  This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother with five children, only two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (two brothers and one sister). She has run a business selling local gin for five years. She works from her house and sells wholesale only, seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of gin. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She hopes to build a store to house jerrycans of gin and also to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more local gin.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 28 years old and lives in the Gori District with his wife and 3 children.  Besik requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times, for a start-up business, without any success.  His loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family has no source of income.  According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the ‘subsistence poor’ category.  Besik requested a loan from Credo to start a family business.  His loan request was approved as part of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of credit to country rural poor with soft conditions, as they are considered “high risk borrowers” and do not have access to credit products.

With this loan, Besik will purchase pigs to resell at a higher price in order to increase the family’s income.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old. She is a single mother of two children. She sells vegetables in Kiambu and has been in this business for 11 years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 60,000 (sixty thousand shillings).

This will be Jane's seventh loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her children. She wants to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Baddy

texts.es:
Baddy, de 27 años. Es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 2 hermanas, en su casa propia desde que nació. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en el bordado de chalecos de Huaylas, principal danza típica de la región. Gracias a su habilidad en el bordado, tiene muchos pedidos de manera semanas, ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en este negocio. Pero la habilidad lo adquirió desde niño, pues sus padres le enseñaron el oficio familiar. En esta fecha tiene muchos pedidos por lo que tendrá que trabajar al doble, “tengo que aprovechar al máximo, ya que las ganancias son buenas”, comenta. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la construcción, ahora tiene que techar y remodelar una escuela de la ciudad. Los planes de Baddy, son mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus hermanas, a las que quiere pagar sus estudios de la universidad. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota.
Baddy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de telas por mayor para los bordados
texts.en:
Twenty-seven year old Baddy is a responsible young man and has lived in the same family-owned house all his life, along with his parents and two sisters.  Baddy's main income comes from sewing vests for "Huayla", a typical dance in the region.  Thanks to his talents in embroidery, he receives many orders every week and he now has three years experience in this business.  However, he learned this skill as a child, when his parents taught him this family trade.  He currently has many orders and is having to work twice as much: "I have to take full advantage as I am earning good money", he says.  In addition to this work, Baddy also works as a builder and he is currently replacing the roof of and renovating one of the city's schools.  Baddy plans are to improve his income to help his sisters - he wants to pay for their university studies.  Baddy belongs to the "Mollecito" solidarity group and this is his second loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support as that way he will feel secure as he progresses with his business.  He also promises to make his repayments on time.

Baddy will invest the money in buying material in bulk for embroidery.

loans.use: to buy material in bulk for embroidery.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is applying for a second loan of 50,000 KSH after successfully repaying his previous loan.  He is very grateful as it helped to improve his family’s living conditions and monthly income.  This loan will be used to buy items for a new shop (sugar, wheat, and flour).

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat, and flour for his shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 60-year-old, single woman with two children >18yrs old.  She sells ready-cooked food and soft drinks in Kiambu.  She has been in this business for 10 years and makes a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

Mary plans to use this loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk.  In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sadashib

texts.en:
Sadashib is a 37-year-old physically challenged person. He lives with his parents, wife and a child who is schooling. 

Sadashib owns and manages a small grocery store in his village. He sells food items like rice, lentils, pickles, salt, onions, potatoes, spices, etc. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market in Nayagarh to get more stock. 

He wants to reinvest in his grocery store, so that he can stock up more inventory at his shop to meet the demand of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying costs. This will increase Sadashib’s earning capacity.

Sadashib has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more items of what he is selling right now, add more variety to his product line, add more stock of goods to his grocery shop, and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, pickles, salt, onions, potatoes, spices, etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Twende Mbele A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth’s group has 14 farmers and is located in the Bungoma South District.  Elizabeth is pictured on the right with her hand raised.  She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.  Elizabeth first enrolled with the One Acre Fund during the 2011 “long rains” season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 season.  Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize per 2 acres.  But after joining One Acre Fund during the long rains of 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre.  She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to buy clothing for herself and the family.  During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit.  Elizabeth’s group will receive 7 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo in a yellow T-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 21 años, es una madre soltera, tiene una pequeña hija llamada Verónica. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia, desde que nació. La confección de faldas típicas, es su principal ingreso económico. Sus padres desde muy pequeña le enseñaron el oficio familiar. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en la fabricación de manera independiente. En todo este tiempo logró obtener una maquina industrial, gracias a su esfuerzo. Su trabajo consiste en pedidos de faldas típicas, “tengo mayor ingreso económico con los bordados de faldas a mano, me tardo un promedio de un mes y logro ganar mil soles promedio, por falda”, comenta. Ahora comenzó la temporada festiva de Santiago, (fiesta en honor a los animales), donde tiene muchos pedidos de faldas para que bailen los pobladores en la festividad, por lo que contrató a su tía para que le ayude, espera obtener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para sus bordados.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 21, is a single mother.  She and her young daughter, Veronica, live with her parents in the house where she grew up.  She owns a sewing business that is now her main source of income.  Her parents taught her to sew when she was growing up, tailoring having been something of a family business.  Elizabeth started the business 3 years ago and quickly managed to buy an industrial-scale sewing machine of her own.  She mostly makes traditional skirts.  "I make most of my income from hand-embroidering skirts . . . they take a month to make and I earn an average of one-thousand soles per skirt", she says.  The Festival of Santiago (patron saint of animals) starts soon and Elizabeth expects many orders for skirts because local women want them for dances scheduled during the festival.  So many orders, in fact, that she plans to hire her aunt to help her.  Elizabeth belongs to the "Mollecito" community bank and this will be her second MFP loan.  She likes the support she receives from the bank and says it will help her to ensure the success of her business.  She, in turn, is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of fabric and thread for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Hector De Jesús

texts.es:
Hector de 54 años de edad, es de procedencia campesina, oficio que heredó de sus padres. Toda su vida ha laborado en la agricultura y desde hace seis años alterna su oficio con la cría y levante de pollos de engorde, los cuales comercializa en su municipio en tiendas y supermercados. Gracias a esta actividad su condición de vida ha mejorado considerablemente. Su mayor sueño es ampliar sus galpones y tener gallinas ponedoras para convertirse en el mayor distribuidor de huevos en su municipio, pero es conciente que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos de levante, con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ingresos para garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y comenzar a materializar su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Hector is 54 years old and comes from an agricultural background which he inherited from his parents. All of his life he has worked in agriculture, and for six years he has been breeding and raising chickens, which he sells in local shops and markets. Thanks to this business his living conditions have improved considerably. His greatest dream is to expand his coops and breed laying hens in order to become the biggest distributor of eggs in the region, though he knows this is a longer-term goal. 

Currently he is soliciting a loan in order to purchase broiler chickens, with the end goal of increasing his production capacity and improving his income so he can guarantee a better quality of life for his family and begin to realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Magela De Jesus

texts.es: Magela, casada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, estudio Relaciones Internacionales, originaria de la ciudad de León. Inicio su negocio con ayuda de su mama, sus primeros productos fueron verduras, gaseosas, el cual le ayudo a pagar su carrera universitaria. Actualmente sobrevive gracias a la pulpería pues la crisis económica y la escasez de trabajo no le han permitido desarrollarse en el campo profesional. Pero esto no la desmotivo a salir adelante y seguir con su negocio buscando como mejorarlo cada día. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar  jugos, gaseosas, agua embotellada, verduras y frutas. Su expectativa es invertir en la compra de nuevos y mejores productos para surtir su pulpería y lograr convertirla en una distribuidora de productos variados para el hogar.
texts.en:
Magela is married, works as a retailer, and owns a small grocery store. She studied international relations, and comes from the city of León. Magela started her business with her mother’s help, and the first products she sold were sodas. This helped her to pay for her university degree. She now gets by thanks to her grocery store, as the financial crisis and lack of work have meant that she was unable to continue with her professional career. However, this did not discourage her from getting ahead in life and continuing with her business, and she is constantly looking for ways to improve it. 

Magela has requested this financing to buy juices, sodas, bottled water, vegetables and fruit. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of new and improved products to supply her grocery store, turning it into a distribution point for various products for the home.

loans.use: To buy juices, sodas, bottled water, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Sushant Kumar

texts.en:
Sushant Kumar is a 26-year-old differently abled person living with his parents in a small village of Nayagarh district in Odisha, India. He owns and manages a small variety store where he sells biscuits, hair oil, mosquito repellents, deodorant, talc, wafers, etc. 

Sushant Kumar wants to enhance his business by adding more stock of what he sells; also a few more new varieties of products like electric bulbs, soda, chocolates, pickles, toothbrushes, etc., for which he has applied for a loan of 25,000 INR. He says that doing so will increase his monthly income and his family's economic status.

Sushant Kumar has a dream to give a quality life to his parents and save some money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, hair oil, mosquito repellents, deodorant, talc, wafers, etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married, with three children. Two of her children go to school. She has a drug clinic and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000/= (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets.  

Mary works in a shop that she rents. She sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality, taxes, and defaulters. 

She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked clinic and also build a rental house which will house the clinic. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets for her clinic.

loans.name: Upendo Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her mid-40s, is married with two sons, one of whom goes to school. The other one is small.  

Nuru has been selling fried chicken and fish for two years now. She works from 11:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nuru's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more fish and chicken, and covered household expenses. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She will use this loan to buy more chicken and fish to fry and sell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group, "Upendo Kigogo", with 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 50 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Armando, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas Karina a la que apoyan en su casa propia, que adquirió hace 30 años.

Ella cuida de su nieto mientras pueda pues su hija trabaja. Su principal actividad económica es la confección de mandiles típicos que las mujeres utilizan como vestimenta diaria, le va muy bien en su trabaja tanto así que viaja a las diferentes ciudades para venderlas por unidad, ya que de esa manera puede obtener mayores ganancias, pero en festividades realiza por mayor ya que recibe pedidos. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras, las cuales lleva al mercado mayorista por cantidad, ahí obtiene un dinero extra. Por su parte su esposo trabaja en el trasporte público con un ómnibus que adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo, la cual le sirve para trasladar a los pobladores de la ciudad de Cochas hacía el centro de Huancayo. Ella se siente muy feliz, pues sus hijos mayores le mandan constantemente una mensualidad, gusta de verlos desarrollados.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota.
Antonia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para realizar los mandiles, como hilos y telas de diversos colores.
texts.en:
Antonia, who is 50 years old, is a hard working woman. She lives with Armando, her husband for the past 23 years. They have 4 children, but only one, Karina, lives with them. They support her in their own home, which Antonia got 30 years ago.

She minds her grandchild while she can, as her daughter works. Her main economic activity is making traditional aprons that the women use for everyday wear.  Her work is going very well, so much so that she travels to the different cities around to sell the aprons by the unit. This way gives her higher profits. However, during festivals she sells the aprons in bulk as she receives orders for them. She also buys and sells dried vegetables. She sells these at the wholesale market. This gives her some extra money. 

For his part, her husband works in public transport with a bus that he acquired thanks to her work. He transports the residents of city of Cochas to the centre of Huancayo. She is very happy as her older children always send her a monthly allowance. She is delighted to see them doing well. She is a member of the solidarity group called “Mollecito” and this is the 11th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she will have financial support and feels sure that her business will progress.  She also promises to make her payments.

Antonia will invest the money requested to buy materials to make aprons, such as thread and different coloured fabric.

loans.use: to buy materials to make aprons, such as thread and different coloured fabric

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lesbia de  44 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad, e independiente, originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta cocinar comida típica para su familia como gallo pinto, nacatamales comida propia de la región. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económico lo cual la obligo a trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica destace y venta de la carne elaborada con el cerdo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Actividad que la desempeña los fines de  semana cuando existen mayor demanda de dicho productos, productos como nacatamales, chicharrón, yuca, moronga, carde cerdo, chancho frito, chicharon blanco. Tiene 23 años tener el negocio. En la foto se muestra con hojas donde se embuelve el nacatamal. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos para su posterior comercialización. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. Lesbia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lesbia, 44, is married and has two grown children.  She grew up in the "departamento" of Leon in western Nicaragua.  In her spare time, she likes to cook for her family.  She makes traditional food: gallo pinto, nacatamales and other dishes common to this region.  Unfortunately, she had to leave school early because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  She had to go to work at a young age, instead, to help with family expenses.  Thanks to a strong spirit and a drive to get ahead, she was able to start her own pork-sales business.  She operates the business from her house and is especially busy on weekends when there's the most demand for her products from customers who buy what she sells to make nacatamales, chicharron, yucca, moronga, carde cerdo, chancho frito, chicharon blanco and other pork-based dishes.  She has operated the business for 23 years.  That's Lesbia, in the photo, with leaves that she uses to make nacatamales.  She will use this loan to stock her business with products that she sell later.  Lesbia likes her work very much and says that she is grateful to Kiva investors for their support.  Their loans, she says, make it possible for people with few resouces in poor countries like Nicaragua to make a decent living.

loans.use: to raise pigs for her food business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa repairs mobile phones to earn an income. 

Issa was unable to complete school because his parents were unable to raise the money for his school fees, and at the age of 20, he found himself with no source of income at all, depending on his parents for survival. Like some of his childhood friends, he took to collecting scrap metal to sell to steel-making industries. He did this for about a year, and then decided to learn the business of mobile phone repair from a friend who was already a mechanic engaged in this activity. 

After he had trained with his friend for a time, he went into the business on his own. He purchased tools using money he had saved from the scrap business and eventually opened a small workshop, where he now does his repair work. Due to demand, he has since started stocking phone accessories as an additional business.

Once he was financially on his feet, Issa decided to marry. He and his wife Kemirembe Miriam have a four-month-old baby. His wife helps him run the business.

Due to the desire to gradually expand the business, Issa has opted to take out a loan. He will use his loan funds to purchase more phone accessories to offer for sale because they move fast and he earns good income from them.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cruz del Socorro, de  58 años de edad, soltera con siete hijos mayores de edad. Originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Cruz del Socorro se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable, en sus pagos, y lo ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Ha sido una mujer muy luchadora la cual ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para ganarse el pan de cada día. Por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar solamente la educación primaria.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante, es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos y productos lácteos, desde hace  25 años. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en un lugar especifico de su localidad. La rutina de Cruz es trabajar unas 8 horas diaria, ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos el cual se lo están ofreciendo a un buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Cruz del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cruz del Socorro, is single and has seven grown children.  She grew up in the "departamento" of Leon in western Nicaragua.  She is a hard-working, responsible woman who has repaid past loans on time and in accordance with all terms and conditions.  She knows how to work hard because she's had to work hard all her life just to put food on the table.  She had to leave school early because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  
Cruz started her own pork- and milk-sales business 25 years ago, a business that she scraped together thanks to her great spirit and drive to get ahead.  She operates the business in the town.  She normally works 8 hours a day and says that she likes her work very much.  She will use this loan to buy pigs that she will resell at a better price.  She thinks the investment will help her to increase her income sooner rather than later.  Cruz is grateful to Kiva lenders and says that their loans make it possible for people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Bong's Group

texts.en:
Bong was born in 1981. She has a little child. Her husband is an electricity worker. His income is 3,000,000 VND per month. Bong sews clothes to earn a living. She earns 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy thread and buttons to do her job. 

Her dream is to allow her children to have good careers.

Other members which are part of Bong's group include the following: 
- Loc was born in 1979. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for chickens. 
- Them was born in 1978. She has two children. She sells groceries in the market. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy rice and dried food for her store. 
- Chat was born in 1972. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy for her animals. 
- Thoa was born in 1980. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy groceries to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy thread and buttons to do her job.

loans.name: Bayardo

texts.es: Bayardo es de la Comarca llamada San José de los Remates, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. El realiza esta actividad desde los  10 años ayudando a su  tío en la siembra,  debido a que su papa se fue de la casa, luego al casarse  el decide seguir con esta misma actividad de la siembra, del cual ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera su cosecha. Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar animales como (vaca) y a la misma vez comprar semilla de frijol y maíz.  El espera almacenar  bastantes granos básicos para vender  durante  la época de verano que es cuando empieza  a escasear el producto. Unos de sus proyectos es  comprar ganado y tierras para mejorar sus ingresos. Una de sus metas próximas es poner un centro venta de leche al por mayor.
texts.en:
Bayardo is from the region of San Jose de los Remates, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married and has four children, and is dedicated to the cultivation of corn and beans. 

He has been doing this for the last 10 years, helping his uncle with cultivation, because his father left them. Later, when Bayardo married, he decided to keep doing the same work, from which he has been able to get ahead with the income he makes from the harvest. 

He Is requesting a loan to buy animals (like a cow) and at the same time buy beans and corn seed. He hopes to store enough grains to sell during the summer which is when the product becomes scarce. One of his projects is to buy cattle and land to improve their income. One of his next goals is a central location to sell milk wholesale.

loans.use: to buy animals (like a cow) and at the same time, buy beans and corn seed.

loans.name: Lirio

texts.en:
Lirio, 22 years old, is married and has two children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo, in a mountainous area. Most of the family's income comes from their farming business. Lirio has owned and run a general store for one year. She is thankful because her gained profits go to their daily necessities, the monthly electric bill and some family savings.

Lirio would like to increase the volume of her groceries, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy items such as sugar, eggs, soft drinks and soap for her general store. Lirio hopes that she will obtain this loan for her to gain better profit and to have a continuous smooth flow of business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, eggs, soft drinks and soap

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika, 29 years old, lives in Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Both Radhika and her husband are actively involved in a farming business. They have a thresher machine which they use to earn money by threshing fellow farmers' paddies and wheat.

Radhika has requested a loan amount of NPR 60,000 to buy another threshing machine so that she can expand her business. Her long association with Nirdhan Utthan bank has helped her to buy some land from the proceeds of her threshing business. She has faced hardship in earlier days. Now she is happy due to the performance of the business.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Esta is in her mid-30’s and married with one child, who is currently in school.  She has been running two businesses for the past year (charcoal, fruits and vegetables).  She works from 8 AM to 8 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Esta's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy items (sacks of charcoal, fruits, vegetables), to pay school fees, and to cover household expenses.  She has repaid all of her loans successfully.  She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables to sell. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Esta will share this loan with her loan group "Jitahidi Msakuzi".  Each of the group’s 15 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Daniel specializes in hand-carved African masks and drums. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood, polish, sandpaper and glue to increase production.

Daniel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm married, and I have four children but I also look after five other children. I had already worked in carpentry when my brother-in-law Samuel taught me the art of carving. I specialize in traditional masks and African drums, and I usually get a good response from people. However, due to financial constraints, I'm not able to produce enough to meet the demand. I love to create new designs, so I constantly work to diversify my collection. I have taught more than ten people how to carve, and they are also well-established in this trade.

"I thank the people involved in this microcredit. It will help me to continue carving the works you have favored."

Use the link below to view Daniel's hand-carved masks and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6552

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood, polish, sandpaper and glue to increase production

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to stock up on the silver he uses to craft his jewelry.

Made has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I recall how I learned the silversmith art from a family member. He taught me after school and at that time, the tools we used were still very traditional. I first learned to hammer silver by hand and sometimes I'd miss and hit my hand! When I was learning to place tiny silver granules, I'd fall asleep. But I was eventually able to craft earrings by myself. Then I learned to design my own items, and my dream is to see my jewelry worn by people around the world."

"I want to say thanks to all of you who help to fund this loan. I need it to buy silver so I can replenish the jewelry as it sells and develop a few new designs. Thank you for your support. I hope this will help me to grow little by little."

Use the link below to view Made's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7147

loans.use: to stock up on the silver he uses to craft his jewelry

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 42 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a kiosk where she sells everyday household staples like soap, shampoo, bread, milk, snacks, and other products.  She is a very hardworking lady who always desires to improve her position and to achieve her dreams.  She has been doing this for the last four years and that has given her enough experience and helped her to increase her profit margin.

She is requesting a 20,000 KSH loan from YEHU, where she has been a member for the last two years.  With this loan she will stock her business with wheat and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy wheat and maize flour for her food stall.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni is an artisan from Bali who specializes in batik art on silk. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silk for her shawls and scarves.

Yuni has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I learned the art of batik from my mother when I was very young. She has been making batik at home in Java for over 23 years, while waiting each day for my father to come home from the sea. We still design together, especially the floral and bird motifs that are typical in Pekalongan batik. My husband Rieckey also helps me a lot, but as a  local Balinese woman, I'm very proud of the fact that I can have the career that I love and be able to provide for myself and my family.

"It means a lot to us that you support us through this microcredit. It will help us to keep on crafting your favorite shawls and scarves, as well as to try out new designs." 

Use the link below to view Yuni's silk batik items on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5981

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silk for her shawls and scarves

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA”  iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en chompas, tienda de abarrotes, tejido a telares, tejido de chompas, venta de artefactos, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que hace un 16 años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por  iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los consultorios médicos de la institución.
texts.en:
The FUENTA DE VIDA community bank is starting its twenty-fifth round of funding with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana.  The community bank has eight members and is led by a board headed by its president, Sra. Alejandra.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: clothes-making, grocery sales, cloth weaving, crafts sales and juice sales.  

This loan will benefit the small businesses of Sra. Alejandra and the community bank's other members.  Sra. Alejandra started working with Pro Mujer 16 years ago, after she was invited to join a community bank by a friend who was a member.  Now she has her own sweater-making business and she wants us to know that she learned the business on her own initiative.  
 
Sra. Alejandra will use this loan to buy wool for making sweaters.  She will buy the wool at a market in La Paz, cart it back to her town and use it to make sweaters.  The income that she will make from selling the sweaters will make it possible for her to support her family.  She is married and has three children. 

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes that she can arrange medical visits through the institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her textiles business.

loans.name: Savitri

texts.en:
Savitri is a 38-year-old woman from Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District. She is married to Shankar. For the last 10 years, Savitri has been involved in a business purchasing and selling grain. She goes to different villages, purchasing and selling good grains in the local market.

Savitri has requested a loan of NPR 20,000 with Nirdhan Uthhan Bank limited branch office to support her grain sales business. Savitri has good support from her husband in this business. They are happily married and have one son. This business has given Savitri respect in society and she is seen as an inspiring figure among the women fraternities in the village.

loans.use: to buy grains from villages to resell in the rural market

loans.name: Chamanpi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMAMPI SARTASIÑANI”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mercadería de alasitas, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces y golosinas, venta de muebles, salón de belleza, tejidos, bordados computarizados, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de todo tipo de prendas de vestir; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo al iniciar su taller de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el equipamiento de su taller (compra de máquina recta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The CHAMAMPI SARTASINYANI community bank is starting its sixth round of funding with Proj Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch.  The community bank has eight members and is led by a board headed by Sra. Monica, its president.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: merchandise sales, a corner shop, snack sales, furniture sales, a beauty salon, cloth-weaving, computerized embroidering services and food sales.

This loan will benefit the small businesses of Sra. Monica and the community bank's other members.  Sra. Monica tells us that this is her second round of funding and that she was invited to join the community bank by a friend who is a member.  She operates a clothes-making business.  She makes all kinds of clothing and says that she started the business with her husband who also makes clothes.  
 
Sra. Monica will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine.  She will buy the machine at a market in El Alto and install it in her workshop.  The income that she will make from selling the sweaters will make it possible for her to support her family.  

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health training and loans they provide..

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married with seven children. Juvy is 48 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Tangub City.

Juvy sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more fish for the additional capital raised from selling fish.

Juvy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of selling the fish and to became a fish dealer in her place.

loans.use: to buy more fish for the additional capital raised from selling fish

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn, 28 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Tangub City. For the past 5 years, Rosalyn has been selling fish, earning a monthly income of PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell. Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using her profits to grow the business bigger and to achieve her business dreams.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Koraisha

texts.en:
Koraisha is a 36-year-old married women from Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District. She is married to Mr. Allamudin. 

Mrs. Koraisha and her husband have been in the business of selling food grain for the last seven years. Mrs. Koraisha goes to different villages and purchases paddy rice and pulses from the village people, and she sells the thus procured grain in the local market at higher prices.  She has requested a loan of NPR 40000.00 (forty thousand) from Nirdhan Utthan Bank, Ltd. branch office to support this ongoing business as a seventh loan. 

With the long association and transactions with Nirdhan Utthan Bank, Ltd., Mrs. Koraisha was able to buy some land in Balirampur Village out of the income from her food grain selling business, and she has been able to educate her son to secondary level. They have earned good local respect in the area where they operate their business.

loans.use: to buy food grain like paddy rice and wheat from the villages to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and married. Angelina works very hard to provide a living.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Angelina has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Angelina would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor muy  emprendedor y con grandes deseos de superación, cultiva  maíz y frijoles a los cuales necesita darle mantenimiento con fungicidas,  insecticidas y abonos, y es para la compra de estos suministros y semillas de estos granos  que está solicitando un crédito de un millón cuarenta mil  colones
(¢1.40.000.00), Manuel depende  de esta actividad para sostener a su  familia, manifiesta que por medio  de este financiamiento saldrá  adelante económicamente.
texts.en: Manuel is a very entrepreneurial farmer with a great desire to excel. He raises corn and beans, which he needs to maintain using fungicides, insecticides, and fertilizers, and it is for the purchase of these supplies and seeds for these crops that he is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 colones. Manuel depends on this work to sustain his family. He states that through this financing he will be able to advance economically.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INSEPARABLES”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de juguetes, venta de jugos, venta de medicina natural, sombrerería, venta de regalos, tejido de busos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sombreros; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió después de años de ser operario de su hermano, que tenía este negocio, posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de la Ciudad de Sucre y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria de la frontera Perú -Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y los consultorios.
texts.en:
The group Inseparables will begin their fifth cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the focal point of Germán Busch, it is made up of 10 members and is directed by a board where Primitiva is the President. The members of the community association are involved in various businesses including: selling cosmetics, corner store, selling toys, selling juice, selling natural medicine, hat shop, selling gifts, making sweaters.

The loan will benefit small businesses, of which Primitiva is a member. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling hats; she tells us that she launched her business after years of working for her brother, who had the business, then afterwards decided to open her own workspace.
 
The loan is to increase capital (to buy leather) that she will acquire from Sucre and later, after she crafts them, she will sell the hats at the fair at the Peru-Bolivia border. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and credit training and the consulting offices.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is married with three children. She is 60 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Florenda sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to to buy fishing materials for catching fish.

Florenda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for catching fish

loans.name: Arceli's Group

texts.en:
Arceli is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Arceli is a farmer, and grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to finance land preparation. 

Arceli has been a member of PMPC for two years.  She is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of land preparation.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old, and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga.  She is single with no children
. 
To earn a living, Imelda has a business buying and selling bananas. She earns about PHP 2800 each month doing this type of work. Imelda has  requested a loan to purchase raw bananas.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase 500 kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 47 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. They are currently residing in the village of La Paz. She manages a livestock business, particularly hog-raising, and she's been in this business for almost 15 years. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. From every hog that she sells, she gets a net income of PHP 7,000. Her income is spent on their daily expenditures and also on allowances for their children. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to repair the pig pens for her hogs.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a food business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables, meat, chicken and some ingredients.

Elvie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken and some ingredients

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is widow with 4 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.

Debbie sells assorted groceries and beverages to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 4,900 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase additional stock to sell.

Debbie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase 15 boxes of assorted groceries and beverages

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old and married with two children.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
